page.title: 15FARMING LEADENHAM CROPS
page.content: Although Lincolnshire has long been thought of as a potato growing area, very few are now grown in the part around Leadenham. This is largely due to the labour needed.Wheat and Barley are the main grain crops grown at the present time. Grass is grown for silage and as hay for winter feed.One crop now widely grown in the area is oil seed rape which covers the land with brilliant yellow in the flowering season.The other main crop grown around Leadenham is sugar beet.This is lifted from September onwards and is transported in lorry loads to the local Sugar Corporation factory at Kelham.Over the past years the growing of sugar beet and the subsequent processing of sugar has increased greatly and this has lowered the need for the import of sugar from overseas.
